intro: Plectranthus buergeri, commonly known as African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Plectranthus buergeri is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
